Entries.DialogueText: A present!... with optimal timing. Today is the anniversary of my birth.
Let's see what it is...
A present!... with optimal timing. Today is the anniversary of my birth. Thank you!
Wow, an intact dinosaur egg! This is an extremely rare specimen. Now, if only it could be incubated...
Wow, this is a rare substance. I'll have to take it to the lab for... uh... further analysis.
Yes, Maru told me the news. I can't say I'm thrilled about it, but maybe you'll prove me wrong.
*sigh*...
Well, we'd better titrate this solution before it crystallizes on us.
Really? I figured a farmer would know the correct answer...
See? agrees with me.

'How's that cave experiment coming along? Has it produced anything of value yet?_Yes_Ah! That means the conditions must be more suitable than I originally theorized... hmm..._No_Well, keep checking on it every now and then. I'm sure those little guys will yield something eventually.'
Don't forget to check that farm cave! There's bound to be something useful in there by now.
Maru sure spends a lot of time working on those gadgets of hers.
I'm glad she's so dedicated.
I'm still flabbergasted about Maru's secret robot... was it all a dream?
During this time of year I divert my attentions to fungi.
Let's see... perhaps the nitrogen fixation level is affected by nematode secretions...
Oh! Sorry. I was pondering some data and I didn't notice you there.
Do you need anything?
How's the farming business going? It's corn season, isn't it?
I can imagine it being pretty peaceful, working outdoors with plants all day.
We know a lot about nature thanks to science.
But there's always a lot more to learn.
Hi . I'm always glad when you come for a visit.
It's nice to have some company after all this lonely lab-work.
I heard you visited Calico Desert recently. How fascinating! I'm sure you observed many unique life forms on your trip.
Robin has a hot temper. It's better to stay on her good side.
Don't tell her I said that.
...now if I could only quantify her mood levels, perhaps I could model the fluctuations using a sinusoidal curve...
Don't mind me, . I'm just collecting some samples. This may be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!
Erm... If you see my wife, can you tell her I'm okay?
The rain appears to be harmless, so I'm taking less precaution this year.
Greetings! I'm Demetrius, local scientist and father. Thanks for introducing yourself!
I'm studying the local plants and animals from my home laboratory.
Have you met my daughter Maru? She's interested to meet you.
*sigh*... , I've come to accept that it's time for my 'little girl' to become a woman. You have my blessing.
Congratulations on the marriage. Robin's been crying since the wedding. 'Tears of joy', as she calls it! A most peculiar concept...
Hmm, now that the basement is unoccupied, I might have to expand the laboratory...
Maru helps me out in the lab sometimes... She's a good kid.
It's hard to do good science without Maru's help...
But her happiness is much more important than my experiment!
Robin won't even tell *me* who paid for Pam's new house!
I pretend I'm mad at her but secretly I'm glad she's so loyal to her word...
Say that again!? You successfully incubated a dinosaur egg? This is unprecedented!
Here, take my coffee, I'm all worked up now... I can't drink any more.
Checking up on the melon research? Yes, I... uh... 'analyzed' it, and it certainly has an optimal macronutrient profile...
Fruit and salt? What an odd combination...
It's a good specimen, but a very common species. You can keep it.
Can you believe this place? It's teeming with exotic life!
I usually don't partake... but I'm usually not on a tropical island, either. Hahaha.
Are you having fun, ? You need to remember to take breaks now and then too!
I already spotted a rare crab. This place is great.
I'll be analyzing this data for months.
*crunch*... whoops, there goes an endangered crab species...
Oh, never mind. It was just the empty shell! I can sleep tonight.
Let's see... If compounds in the rhizosphere contain sufficient levels of Carbon-13, then...
40#So I heard Maru had you look through that telescope out back.|If you and Maru become friends, I'm sure she'll show you how to use that telescope out back.
Pretty exciting, huh?
I hope my daughter's keeping up on her math and science!
is deep in thought.
Sorry, I'm really busy.
There's so many plants to study right now.
I became a scientist because I wanted to contribute to the progression of our species.
Of course, none of this would be possible without farmers such as yourself.
Hmm... If strigolactone levels could be increased, would it have a proportional effect on mycorrhizal growth?
How's the farming business going? It's tomato season, isn't it?
Make sure to water your plants every day.
Although, if you're using water retaining soil you don't need to worry about watering as often.
It's pretty convenient.
It's good to take a break from work every now and then.
I guess that's kind of difficult when you live on a farm, though.
Hey, at least in the winter you don't have to worry about crops.
How's the farming business going? It's parsnip season, isn't it?
This valley has a very vibrant and diverse ecosystem. That's one reason I was excited to move here.
You're probably growing a lot of interesting plants on your farm, huh?
Maybe I'll stop by your place some day and check it out.
Hi ! How are you doing today?
I wish I could make your farming job easier somehow.
Hello.
seems lost in thought.
Thanks for stopping by. I need to think about something other than legumes for a while.
So, what have you been doing lately?
That sounds interesting.
I'm taking a break from my research right now.
Let's see... if seasonal nitrogen levels could be modeled by a piecewise function...
Oh! Sorry. I was analyzing data and I didn't notice you there.
Feel free to harvest as much lumber and stone from this area as you please.
Do you have any animals on your farm?
Talk to my wife if you want to increase the size of your house.
Do you have a kitchen in your house yet?
Cooking is kind of like doing lab work.
Hi ! I have some good news for you. A few days ago I made a breakthrough in my research on the local environment.
I'll spare you the technical details and get to the point... You know that empty cave you have, over in the cliffs?
Well, I have a way to turn it into something useful... for both of us.
I'd like to set up the cave to attract some local species. That way I can observe them in a more controlled environment. And you can harvest whatever products they produce.
I can either set up the cave to attract mushrooms or fruit bats. The bats will sometimes leave fruit for you to collect.
Alright! I'll go set it up for you right now! It shouldn't take any time at all.
Thanks for letting me do this.
I'm excited to see what happens with that cave. Aren't you?
I hope you're pleased with the work I did.
Ah Ha! I knew it!
Agh! What is it?!
Sweet Yoba... it talks!
This is why you've locked yourself in your room the last few months?
...and I thought you were down here fooling around with ...
It's okay, Maru. Let MarILDA go free.
Your mother and I can take care of ourselves. I know you're ready to start a life of your own, and I've come to terms with the thought of not having you around anymore.
Besides, this... creation of yours seems pretty advanced. It wouldn't feel right to keep her as a servant.
, I'm sorry I mistrusted you. You're a ${good guy
fine young woman}$.
I've never seen Maru so lively and creative... and I've never been more proud of her. If you've had a hand in that, then you have my gratitude.
Um... Robin? What's the point of the four posts? It seems like an inefficient use of materials.
Hmm, I see your point.. But we can't let that outweigh the utility and efficiency of the sleep receptacle.
I don't understand. Tomatoes are fruits!
! I'm glad you're here. You'll be able to put this argument to rest.
59 null 59 -30 Event_tomato1 59 50 Event_tomato2#Fruit
I just want you to understand my point of view.
It's hard for me to know exactly what assumptions I should make when you tell me something.
But I'll try to get better at it.
Thanks for your help, .
Thanks for helping out, .
Maru's a good kid. She's my special little girl...
I wouldn't want anything getting in the way of her bright future, know what I mean?
Just some food for thought... *chuckle*
...I was just telling about the soil samples we're testing.
15933 null 15933 10 Event_Lab_Silence 15933 -100 Event_Lab_Rat#Actually, your Dad was being weird.
Okay, okay... we were talking about you, sweetie.
I wanted to say a few things to about you... but I didn't want to embarrass you. I shouldn't have lied about it.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_alt
Entries.DialogueText: I'm in.
I love your art, Leah! 'Post-Dimensional Nullspace' is my favorite.
Robin really works hard on her carpentry stuff... she deserves a little recognition now and then.
Sheep have remarkable memory capabilities... retaining familiarity with both fellow sheep and humans...They even form friendships, mirroring the close bonds we humans cultivate with one another!
I haven't seen Maru in hours... I hope she's alright.

Did you know... a study in the Journal of Anthropological Physiology found that the cadence, tempo, and key of music can have a measurable impact on cortisol levels?Er... Is there vanilla ice cream to go with the blackberry cobbler?
Egg... what a strange thing to eat.
Hey , did you get a taste of my carp roe pie?...What? It is the 'egg' festival, isn't it?
These springtime dances can be traced back to ancient fertility rituals.Hey... You should know about this stuff, farmer.
Gatherings like this give a sense of identity to our community.Or as my wife says... 'it makes the town lively'!
This is tiring, honey. Are you ready to visit the buffet soon? *pant*
Why do humans enjoy dancing? Perhaps it is an instinctual mechanism, so that we will inadvertently convey our genetic quality to potential mates?
The 'Moonlight Jelly'... what a remarkable species! We're very lucky that they stop here on their long journey south.It's unknown why they are attracted to light... very curious.
There's a different kind of 'jelly', that anglers sometimes pull out of the water. Despite the name, they are very different in nature to the Moonlight Jellies...
I'll probably get another tool set this year... *sigh*
Hmm... this green jelly has a minty flavor to it.I wonder how mint became associated with the Feast Of The Winter Star? Does mint even grow in Winter?
You know what? I probably should've worn a jacket.
Water ice... a most profound substance, indeed. Necessary for life, it makes a fitting material for statuary meant to represent the living form.
You're giving this to me? This is amazing!
Thank you! This is a very interesting specimen.
...What is this?
This is disgusting.
That was very thoughtful of you.
